column3: This mall has many good stores and eating choices with a food court and several chain restaurants too. I even walk around this mall for exercising purposes. There's ample free parking both outdoors and in a covered garage.

Had not been to this mall in years and didn’t know it was no longer called Fox Hills Mall or that all the new stores had been added, so can imagine my surprise. Whoever came up with the redesign did a fantastic job. This was a dying mall in a decent neighborhood but, for some reason, attracted a somewhat seedy crowd. Now, it hums on Weekends with a full parking lot and ordinary shoppers just looking for some great bargains. In addition to Macy’s, which has been renovated and has upgraded its merchandise mix, the mall now has a Nordstrom Rack, Best Buy and Target. It even has a nice food court, although it’s the standard fast food vendors found at most malls, and a children’s play court to keep the kids entertained. I feel good about saying it’s a good place to shop based on my experience and would go again.

As we had a couple of hours before our flight, we drove to this mall for lunch and some last min shopping.The food court at plethora of food that you will be spoilt for choices. And it has all the leading stores there so if you need to grab a last min gift, the mall saves you for sure!
Very nice place to shop! A lot of shops, restaurants, cafes ... etc. available there! The mall was little crowded because of Christmas season!

During two recent visits to the LA area we visited several malls and were pleased with our choices. Having a few hours to kill between flights at LAX we took a ride here. The main anchor stores of Macy’s and Nordstrom were both disappointing compared to those we visited previously. Few of the well known brands are represented amongst the shops in the mall. At the upper level there was a persistent unpleasant odor of cooking oil.

column2: Terrific local mall with plenty of good food options
column3: Westfield Culver City (formerly Fox Hills Mall) is an indoor mall that seems to have an emphasis on food. It has most of the standard mall chain stores, with about every shoe store you can think of. It is anchored by Macys, JC Penney's, Target and Best Buy, and also features an Old Navy and Nordstrom's Rack, among others. It has 2 or 3 levels, depending on which side of the mall you are. There is an attached multi-level parking structure that has plenty of parking for all but the busiest Christmas shopping days.What distinguishes this mall from some others are the food options. There is a spacious food court on the third floor with most types of cuisine. Of particular note are a lot of Asian food options, including a Vietnamese, Mongolian, Chinese, Korean, and Japanese places. Elsewhere in the mall are BJ's Brewhouse, Lucille's BBQ, Olive Garden, Wokano (Asian sit-down place + bar + karaoke), Qdoba, Five Guys, etc.The mall is generally safe and, having been renovated in the past 5-6 years, looks modern and inviting. To me, one of its attractions is the diversity of the shoppers, a genuine snapshot of L.A.

Taxes are more expensive here than some other shopping centres, apparently different areas have different taxes not just the different states.No upmarket department stores, Target, JC Penny, Nordstrom Rack were major stores.
Nice local 2 floor shopping mall with a great food court!! Had a lot of stores I never heard of before too! Overall a pretty decent mall!

Does the job, pretty much every shop you could want is in the mall. There’s no high end stuff but you’ve got your Nike, Adidas, footlocker, finishline, Macy’s, Nordstrom, GameStop, etc. Really conveniently located and some good eateries around too. Have never really had a bad experience here.

Popped over to this simple mall next to my hotel (Four Points Sheraton) after arriving in LAX at night (plus endured customs delay due to system downtime/slowness).All the basic stuffs and necessities, but not a shopping haven for big-time shoppers.

column2: Near LAX and accessible via Lyft & Uber.
column3: Hi, there is a JC Penny for presentable clothing, a Target Store for groceries and etc and a Macy Store for high-end products. An all in one to frequent. It also has a food court with moderate cuisine choices right from Japanese, Mexican, Burger King and etc...
Came here yesterday on our layover before heading home. Decent mall with plenty of variety of shops. First time we’d shopped at a target but it was great.

Visited recently and was disappointed & somewhat saddened by the Westfield Mall - once it was hopping & great, but now it’s just OK. Seems to have lost the major anchor tenants, shops are common types & mediocre, cleanliness & upkeep lags, the heightened presence of Security is concerning. Just OK.

Mall has everything (small to large stores, discount stores, various dining options, entertainment areas, groceries, fitness center, free parking, safety, atmosphere) except Medical and Dental facilities. Add those two and you have a one-stop shop.

column2: Looking for bargain at Culver City
column3: 1. After a day at Universal Studios & on the way back, we stop by at Westfield before heading back to the hotel.2. It have Macy, Nordstrom Rack, Best & Food Terrace. Many more. There bargain at Bath & Body, get few thing for my Wife there & continues going toward Nordstrom.3. Enjoy myself there, it a bit small compare to other Westfield.

Being from Australia, there is a standard to Westfield centres that I expect and Culver City just doesn't meet it. Also having been to the City Century Westfield in the same week, the difference is enormous.Sure, the line up of shops is decent (but then all malls have pretty much the same stores) but the layout and presentation is poor and feels badly in need of renovation.The food court area had a smell that was definitely not enticing to enjoy a meal...

column2: The Malls are Dying. This is Sadly, one of Them.
column3: This mall used to be packed with people, having fun, shopping, walking, hanging out, having some great food. Sadly, this mall is almost like a ghost town. It has a Target and an Old Navy, so I think that keeps the rent paid. Most of the stores are out of business or not open often.Parking is free here, which is great and getting around the mall is pretty easy. The stores that are open have great service and the employees seem to care that you are there and not on line.There are still some great places to eat. We like Five Guys (burgers) and BJs (everything). If you have a chance go there, they need the business. If you are a tourist, you don't have time for this, there is so much more to see.

We stopped by here because we did not have anything to do. We were staying at The Double Tree that is close by. There was a wide range of stores to check out. If you forget something it is a great place to get something. The mall seemed to be a safe place also.

Actually helped my grand daughter to buy two dressesHer parents approved later that dayI managed to buy a pair of shoes , I have been looking forMall was clean, we had a great timeEven saw some Michelle Obama purses, which I will have to go back and buy !
Região perigosa ! Roubaram minha bolsa !!violent place, stole my purse and break the glass of my car !! caution !!!

This mall has many good stores and eating choices with a food court and several chain restaurants too. I even walk around this mall for exercising purposes. There's ample free parking both outdoors and in a covered garage.

Had not been to this mall in years and didn’t know it was no longer called Fox Hills Mall or that all the new stores had been added, so can imagine my surprise. Whoever came up with the redesign did a fantastic job. This was a dying mall in a decent neighborhood but, for some reason, attracted a somewhat seedy crowd. Now, it hums on Weekends with a full parking lot and ordinary shoppers just looking for some great bargains. In addition to Macy’s, which has been renovated and has upgraded its merchandise mix, the mall now has a Nordstrom Rack, Best Buy and Target. It even has a nice food court, although it’s the standard fast food vendors found at most malls, and a children’s play court to keep the kids entertained. I feel good about saying it’s a good place to shop based on my experience and would go again.

As we had a couple of hours before our flight, we drove to this mall for lunch and some last min shopping.The food court at plethora of food that you will be spoilt for choices. And it has all the leading stores there so if you need to grab a last min gift, the mall saves you for sure!
Very nice place to shop! A lot of shops, restaurants, cafes ... etc. available there! The mall was little crowded because of Christmas season!

The main anchor stores of Macy’s and Nordstrom were both disappointing compared to those we visited previously. Few of the well known brands are represented amongst the shops in the mall. At the upper level there was a persistent unpleasant odor of cooking oil.

Nice local 2 floor shopping mall with a great food court!! Had a lot of stores I never heard of before too! Overall a pretty decent mall!

Actually helped my grand daughter to buy two dressesHer parents approved later that dayI managed to buy a pair of shoes , I have been looking forMall was clean, we had a great timeEven saw some Michelle Obama purses, which I will have to go back and buy !
Região perigosa ! Roubaram minha bolsa !!violent place, stole my purse and break the glass of my car !! caution !!!
Westfield is a very busy mall that is well equipped for everything you might need in one location. Parking can be a challenge though.

So I visited Target to pick up a baby shower gift online that I ordered and I delt with Ms latrice, when I approached her I said hello and she didn't say hello back. I don't understand how when in customer service you can't say hello when doing business. I asked her this and she said she speaks sometimes....Really sad state the world is taking on

column2: Don’t bother if you are a tourist
column3: Rather spend your time at the airport. The shops are all super basic and uninteresting. Rather go to Culver City itself ( not the same as the shopping centre

column2: Good parking; good store selection; easy freeway access
column3: My husband and I were dropping off our senior at a summer college program and needed to pick up a few remaining dorm room items and we sought out a Target store. Accessing the store at the Westfield mall in Culver City was much easier than I anticipated. There was plenty of parking, directions to the entrance closest to Target were clear, and all was easy-/easy-out.We live in San Diego where the parking lots are large, flat, and sprawling. I was a bit wary of a multi-level parking complex being “easy” but it all worked out.Thanks, Westfield!
Great mall with good stores, restaurants, Target, and Gold’s Gym. But no movie theaters. And a Veggie Grill would be nice....
This place has everything that you need to buy. There is also a large selection of restaurants to eat at. Just amazing when comparing place in Australia.
Nice one stop mall with a Target and lots of restaurants. The only problem was there was an area that smelled strongly of sewage and it wasn't near the bathrooms.
Lots of stores, busy with lots of people, great food court. Spent a few hours here walking around and shopping.

Unfortunately, the inconvenience of parking and accessible areas for strollers. We were with my parents who have a hard time walking, and the maps inside were unable to forward us to the best route towards our parking spot. Which was the entrance to Dining Terrance. They only had the wheelchair accessible, and the man forwarded us back to target area which guides us to walking around the roof parking with a sleeping baby.
I had to go and get clothes for a shoot. Well i suppose they have "everything" so thats the place to go but really not a "tourist destination".

column2: Fairly decent mall close to airport
column3: We did use this place as our first stop just after leaving airport, to stock up for our trip. Best Buy wasn’t good enough, small and with limited options (fortunately much better one is not too far). Good selection of cosmetics and food options form cheap eats to some more proper dining. Good place to get a SIM card as well (at&t has its shop here and sells prepaid options with data).
Had 30 mins time when I was around and so visited this place. I have visited the earlier one in London which is huge. This too is good. Has good brands and shops. All major ones are covered
I like this place. It’s a typical mall with a Los Angeles Twist!Give it a try.I walked the neighborhood too

column2: Good balance of stores and convenience
column3: The mall has all main anchors stores and also a good availability of convenience as supermarket.Is a good option and also offers a food court with many restaurants.

column2: Good shopping on a nice mall
column3: All the usual brand names like Macey’s, Nordstrom and Target can be found in this nice large mall.Lots of choice, big modern building with some nice food outlets too.Perfect place to find whatever you’re looking for!

column2: Nice mall with lots of shops and food options
column3: As in the title, this is a good place to hangout even as a tourist. I spent most of my trip at the Target store as it had most of what I need but I did take time to shop around the rest of the mall too. Like the space and environment. Can easily see myself returning anytime I am in the neighborhood.

We had a layover in LA so decided to pop to the local mall. Great mall. So many different food outlets to eat at. And allllll the department stores, Macy’s/Target/JC Penney’s. So it meant a very successful shopping trip. Also has free wifi which was incredibly handy for the Skype call we had to take mid way through our shopping experience.

column2: Fantastic food court with unparallelled variety. Really great choices here and a great destination of food places.
column3: Beautiful mall featuring Macy's Best Buy, and Target, with plenty of boutique stores to keep you occupied for an hour or two. Very clean and well kept, a huge departure from a decade ago when it was a shopping center in disrepair and mostly closed stores. They've really upped their game. The best reason to return and keep coming back is for the food court. You won't find Noodles 101 anywhere else except for Alhambra, and their soup dumplings are worth a visit themselves.
My second visit in two years, love this place, a lot of good stores and places to eat. very spacious and clean.
We can find variety of shops ranging from best buy to Macy's. Good choice of food options too. Good experience.
I went to this shopping centre and it was big beautiful with lots of shops and a big restaurant area. It was very clean and easy to navigate. I would go back to this shopping mall
After 12 yrs out of town. Today is my first comeback to westfield Culver City. Wow what a huge improvement. And I love it!

column2: GREAT MALL!! Visited a few times
column3: Love this mall and its selection. It is a lot different than other malls in LA. This one is less snobby, has a lot of affordable stores, and dining options. Highly recommended for shopping or going in a group !

column2: Target is the best awesome snacks
column3: My phone died so went to my international provider ATT. Useless. Then went to target. Lance at the electronic section was a superstar. Found me a great prepaid phone then a power bank and set me up with my provider. When I tried to give him a tip told was not allowed. Best service ever lance deserves a raise and promotion. Also best place for snacks. I had a hazelnut gelato dipped in milk chocolate. And it was happy hour. So good

This shopping centre is easy to get to and from and has most of the major retailers. Food everywhere! Wide open spaces and relaxing to wonder through doing some window shopping. Car park was great and not too busy for a week day.
Nothing special. The better mall in the general area is Westside Pavilion on Pico Blvd.The parking is adequate.
We loved the mall. Walked around one night before retiring back to the hotel. Loved the target inside.

The shopping centre has some good brand shops but the department stores have a limited range of goods for sale and the quality limited.Seems that the centre caters for a particular customer demographic.
It tries but parking lot is hell and the crowd is less than desirable . It's ok for some restaurants however and maybe Nordstrom rack. It used to be the pits. It's just been dressed up a bit

Needed to get our shop on and this was just the place to pickup some deals.A short UBER ride and we were able to pickup some odds and ends. Always happy to find a Target and Best Buy.Finding a Gluten-free meal was more trouble than it should be. It's 2017 folks.
So this is a huge place with multiple levels but it seems dirty. Lots and lots of teenagers in the evening. Same stores as everyone else.

Great for basic shopping, a quick meal and free Wi-Fi.Not bad if you want to go for a walk to your local place.Ground floor has a better offering that the other floors, and some shops remind you that is 2016.Overall is ok!!
Went here on our last day. Lots of different shops to choose from. It is about a 10 minute ride from LAX. Get a uber as its quite cheap to get to.

column2: The Closest Mall to lax international airport
column3: if you want to kill some time on a long layover, this is the place to be.there is sephora, macy's (great bargain there as always), nordstrom rack (a bit messy).plus it's quick to get to in an uber.There is a food court upstairs too, and a place to get your nails done :) (bonus)...enjoy.

Anytime I need anything I go to this mall. It used to be called the Fox Hills Mall. They have a great Target, Best Buy, Macy's, JC Penney's and Nordstrom Rack. Plus all the usual mall stores. I love that I can always find parking and you don't have just the food court when hungry. You have B.J.s, Olive Garden and Lucille's bar-b-que restaurants. There's even a special play area if you have small children.
It's a mall with a great food hall and some brand stores. Plentiful free parking.It's currently nearing the end of some renovations so expect some disruption.

column2: Lots of stores...glaring lights and uneven inventory
column3: I end up here during trips to LA and never really want to return. The mall has a good number of stores and restaurants but it's kind of tacky, noisy and joyless. Yes, there's a crowded Target, a bustley macys and a picked over Best Buy. But the people who frequent the mall smell heavily of marijuana, the store clerks are apathetic and the music is too loud.
Nice mall with great parking and food options. It's quite a maze to walk completely but it's worth it. The mall even has a full sized Target and Best Buy. I like...

We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express LAX and got a taxi to the shopping centre for $15 incl tip.Lots to choose from but not over the top. H&M, forever 21, Target, Macy's, Jc penny, Disney shop, lots of sporting stores and more. Went with a male friend and he shopped more than me!Great food court with plenty to choose from.Highly recommend if you have a few hours to kill between flights or if your stopping overnight.

column2: Lots of shops to buy presents for your friends and family
column3: There are enough shops and restaurants you can use. I especially liked ELF where I can buy cheap cosmetics for my friends. If you don't have enough time shopping in LA, it is a good option cause it is close to the airport.

The Westfield Mall in Culver City is clearly one of the outstanding malls in the Los Angeles. About a mile north of LAX, off of Sepulveda Boulevard, it has an excellent food court and a number of shops and national stores Macys, JC Penny, Nordstrom Rack, Old Navy, Best Buys and Target to name a few. Since it is close to my home, I go there at least once a week to either eat there or buy merchandise.

column2: My city's mall- diversity is a beautiful thing in Culver City!
column3: I like my home town mall. I like the diversity- seeing families and friends together- and other single shoppers taking a break at the mall. I was looking for a bargain and inspiration from current styles at full retail too. I went with a shopping list yesterday and filled it, readily, spending about 90 minutes to browse and narrow in on my purchases.
It's the same as in any mall, a good selection of shops and restaurants. Parking is great. Not too big, just the right size for me and my wife.
Very good very clean and with the stores we need and for all budgets .It's really near the airport and the car parking it's free

If you're staying near LAX the Westfield Mall in Culver City is a great idea if you want to do some shopping. There are plenty of stores to choose from and restaurants if you get hungry.It helped us on our last minute shopping.Plus, parking is free.

This is a really nice, updated mall with lots of great stores. Everything that you'd want for a good day of shopping. The food court has a wide variety of really good food counters. Really enjoyed Mongol Grill!
Nice sized mall with plenty of choices.Food hall was great with a large selection to choose from.Seated areas for weary shoppers were in abundance and very welcome during our visit.

I arrived late in the evening so I was not able to experience the mall in its entirety. However, the parts that I did see were nice. The forever 21 store was huge. You don't have to worry about paying to park at this mall. The trouble is with finding a parking spot.
The mall seems dated and not up with the current times. Lots of carts and smaller stores and not much in terms of services beyond haircuts.
It's the best mall There are a verity of shops with good bargains and the restaurants are good to and it's close to LAX airport and there's a lot of hotels around it
Great different choices. I was able to go with friends and we all got different things that we wanted and still were able to enjoy each other's company.

column2: Good shopping center in LAX area
column3: Good shopping center in LAX area. 3 floors among them one is only for restaurants. Try the Corean and the Japan restaurants. Really good. You find everything in the center: Macy's, Hollister, HM etc.
I guess not much to say about westfield mall because i only been there for one and half hour . There is good resturent in the dinning area i recommend goin there it is kabob resuterent.

Let me talk about their food court and other eateries. It's like an international affair. You have your Vietnamese, Chinese, Japanese, American, Mediterranean, you have a little bit of everything and that's the food court alone. Their restaurants and in the fall of 2016 they are adding more restaurants as well as a Trader Joes grocery store.The shops here are also great. I'm a small boutique store type of person so I can't comment on the Macy's or JC Penny's that's there. The boutique stores are great. Oh this mall also has a Target and a Best Buy if you need stores like that. I feel Westfield Culver City aka. Fox Hills Mall to the locals will be your one stop shopping destination. I live in the area and I'm there at least a few times in the month to shop, eat, or get a chair massage.

From Forever 21, H&M, JC Penny, ALDO, Target, Bath&Body works, Westfield has a great selection of stores. It's also compact enough that you can circle the entire mall and not get too lost, the signs are clear enough. The best part - there's free WiFi and an awesome food court with an array of options from American fast food to Japanese sushi.

Unfortunately because the restaurant is a food court place inside this mall it wouldn't come up. So hopefully this review will get out. One of the best Vietnamese cold noodle salads I have ever had. The mushroom one is most delicious! I highly recommend finding this spot on the upstairs food court in Westfield Mall. It won't disappoint. The owners also have a food truck that appeared on the Food Truck Wars I think 2014. So amazing. There Pho was very good too.
A classic mall, normal don't expext nothim more than average , parking isint so bad ... But the mall directory should have some improvement .

Since Westfield took over this mall in Southern Culver City, they have done a wonderful job of upgrading the stores and restaurants. The food court is terrific and is very busy at lunch and on weekends. The Macy's has a wonderful selection of items and is well stocked. The mall is open and bright and the Target is also well stocked. There are many restaurant options including a Five Guys burger joint. Good store selection, too. There is a small play space and and a train ride for the kids.

Solid Mall, parking can seem tight at typical busy times but most park in the front Lot so go around and try another. The food court has a solid selection and many actually Have A ratings from board of health which is nice. Xtreme Boardshop is a solid skate shop next door to vans and worth a stop in for surf/skate style clothes or Skateboards and Longboards themselves.The only thing that strikes my East coast body weird is no Movie Theatre in the mall.
Nice & convinient mall for all your shopping needs. Also has free wifi! The shops selection could be better, though. A few popular brands are noticeably absent here.

t’s a large mall with three large department stores, Macy’s, Penny’s, and Target. There are over 30 places to get something to eat in this mall. We ate at Five Guys. There is also a Best Buy where I spent most of the money this evening. The mall is very clean and bright. Most anything you could want could be purchased here. There are three stories of stores and eateries.

column2: Not the best of the westfields
column3: Been to lots of better Westfields malls around the state. We went here to go to dinner and went to Olive Garden. The shop selection is pretty good but missing a few personal favourites like Abercrombie.

This is a great shopping centre located near the airport .. They have Macy's, JC Penney, Target, Sephora, Guess and other specialty shops. If you are looking for shopping close to the airport this is a great location!
The property is in excellent condition, restrooms are clean and there are many different restaurants. Also the garage was large and free. There is large selection of shops!
Came here last week while on vacation with some friends as something to do on a rainy evening. We didn't do much but walk around the mall. The selection was great and the mall was huge.
Great food court but the rest is normal mall restaurants. Shops tend to the very young market. And parking is just ok.

Westfield is close to my home and my wife and I go there often, to shop and eat. Macy's and J.C. Penny have excellent bargains. The Food Court is good. Since it was remodeled, it is a pleasant place to be. An excellent place for those leaving the country to shop since it is very close to LAX.

column2: It'll always be Fox Hills Mall to me
column3: Westfield did an outstanding job on revitalizing and creating a brand new shopping and dining experience here. I've patronized this mall for decades ... watched the decline and renovation and I like what they've done here. The expanded indoor food court, restaurants and variety of stores has completely face lifted this once declining mall. I enjoy spending time here. BJ's is a welcome addition as is Target and Best Buy.

column2: This is a good shopping mall. Complete and convenient.
column3: I really like it because it has a macys, nordstrom rack and a target and you do not have to walk a lot to go between these big stores like in other shopping malls. The food court is ok and it also has other restaurants to choose from which are better than the food court.I do recommend this shopping center.Public transportation to and from the mall is great!
Really liked the mall since it has been upgraded and it is a pleasure to shop and eat there. Several popular stores for young and elderly!

Very pleasant mall with a fine selection of stores, especially liked Target for their helpful staff. Incredibly poor signage for exit to parking, I guess they want to trap you in the mall as long as possible whilst they drain your pocket.

column2: easy in and out parking,quality stores and friendly security staff
column3: Best buy and Macys for gifts enjoyable experience .no hassle, quick in and out. Crowded but non stressful

This is a great mall for shopping. It is the closest one to LAX airport and the best one in the area. With anchor stores Macy's, JC Penney, Target, Best Buy, Gold's Gym and great restaurants Olive Garden, BJ's Brewery and Lucille's Bar-be-que balances it off after a great shopping trip. There's a great food court and other eateries in the mall. The mall is also surrounded by great hotels and not that far from Marina del Rey.
Wide varieties of shops and restaurants, target super market which was an advantage, I used to go there everyday after my exams.

This shopping center has it all! Movie theater, restaurants, food court, shops, and a little play area for the kids! We end up here every visit! You do have to pay for parking and be sure to remember where you parked. You can get parking validated at the theater.

This is the weirdest designed mall I've ever been in. There is so much wasted space and inefficient circulation routes. Very hard to navigate your way around. Best Buy's location is the worst. You feel like you are in a labyrinth trying to get there and going through a tunnel to get into the store. Makes no sense. No bookstore or theaters either.

I visited on a Friday around lunch time. It was extremely quiet inside the mall. Not many customers walking around at all. There was a really good variety of stores with many of the larger department stores. The food court was ordinary compared to our Westfields in Sydney. The food choices scared us, with only Burger King as the safe option for us.

This is a nice mall, completely indoors. Nice line up of stores, plenty of sales on 2 weeks before lead up to 4th July. Parking was easy. But my sat nav had problems finding this originally, as there is another mall beginning with West... in Culver City, but that has Century in the name. Spent an hour in traffic on the freeways before I realised our error. Great that Target was part of the main centre, which was a real bonus in terms of access.

Ok! This is the main reason I came to this mall. Well after eating the white cheddar popcorn at home, it's to salty for me. I also tried the cheddar cheese and it was not a favorite. The only one that passed my taste buds is nearly naked. Then I shopped at hallmark, got a orange supreme (squeezed juice) from Jamba juice, and then stopped at Baskin Robbins and they had no sugar added brownie Sundae. ( I was delighted to try it- very good). it's not the best mall that I have visited and some stores are on the outside of the mall, but not a bad stop.

The mall is pretty big. It has both outdoors and indoors features, which is different from Westfield malls that I've been to. It was pouring rain when we went, which was not that great as there is no undercover walkways for you to walk around. So, we end up dashing here and there.Big stores like Macy have a few floors to go through, which is great to keep out of the rain. Parking can be a problem has it was quite busy when we went there, but it is free. I think you can walk around with your pets. We saw that Westfield provide free "dog biscuits" as treats for owners to use them. Perhaps, our experience would have been better if it wasn't raining and that we could easily find a parking spot.
